intro: Pyrus nebrodensis, commonly known as the Nebrodensis pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the island of Sardinia, where it grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, deciduous leaves and yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, edible pear that ripens in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
